meanings.def: a long narrow piece of leather, cloth, etc. that you wear around the middle part of your body
examples: to do up/fasten/tighten a belt
a belt buckle
a studded leather belt
Around his waist he wore a belt.

meanings.def: a continuous band of material that moves round and is used to carry things along or to drive a machine
a narrow area or an area around the edge of something that has particular characteristics
examples: the countryâ€™s corn/industrial belt
We live in the commuter belt.
a narrow belt of trees
a belt of rain moving across the country
Towns in the country's industrial belt were particularly affected by the recession.

meanings.def: an act of hitting something/somebody hard
examples: She gave the ball a terrific belt.
That was distinctly below the belt!

meanings.def: taking more actions than are really necessary to make sure that something succeeds or works as it should
examples: a belt-and-braces policy

meanings.def: to have already achieved or obtained something
examples: She already has a couple of good wins under her belt.

meanings.def: to spend less money because there is less available
examples: With price increases on most goods, everyone is having to tighten their belt.
There is a need for further belt-tightening.
That was distinctly below the belt!

meanings.def: to fasten a belt around something
examples: The dress was belted at the waist.
She belted the coat tightly round her.
Her jacket was belted loosely at the waist.
